page.title: 01The Town Of Dent
page.content: Dent is now a village but in the past it was a very busy trading town. The village is situated to the west of the Yorkshire Dales,yet it is unique in the fact that it is also in the Diocese of Bradford and in the County of Cumbria.Anyone wishing to visit Dent would find that travelling from the South of England they would leave the M6 Motorway at junction 37,go towards Sedbergh,turn right for 5.75 miles to find Dent. The visitor would be delighted to find this beautiful village hidden between the fells,with its cobbled street,stone built houses, Norman church,the river Dee with its limestone pavement bottom,all mixed with history and intrigue. Dentdale is a farming area with magnetic appeal to both locals and incomers who appreciate the arts.
